overview_of_class:
Love, Death, and Music in the 16th Century:

The course will focus on music inspired by two powerful human conditions as related to a variety of rituals, intellectual inquiries, and social contexts from the end of the fifteenth century through the beginning of the seventeenth. Featured repertory will include vernacular love songs, the requiem mass, settings of the Song of Songs, laments inspired by biblical and classical antecedents, entertainment created for weddings, memorial tributes, and drama. Students will be encouraged to perform in class.
